snippet: The defendants accused in the theft of masterpieces from the Kunsthal museum in Rotterdam are seeking an unspecified deal with the authorities so that the artwork can be returned.
abstract: Lawyers for Romanian gang accused of stealing tens of millions of dollars worth of paintings from Kunsthal museum in Netherlands say that paintings have not been burned and that gang wants to cut deal with authorities so that artwork can be returned.

byline.contributor: George Calin contributed reporting from Bucharest, Romania, and Christopher Schuetze from The Hague.

lead_paragraph: The defendants accused in the theft of masterpieces from the Kunsthal museum in Rotterdam are seeking an unspecified deal with the authorities so that the artwork can be returned.

headline.main: Lawyers Hint at Possible Recovery of Stolen Art
headline.print_headline: Lawyers Hint At Possibility Of Recovery Of Stolen Art
